trans-unit.source: Defines the base class for entity templates.
Entity templates are user controls that apply to an entity (a table) instead of to a single data field, as with field templates.
An entity template typically contains several <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControl> controls for rendering data fields.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl"></xref> class.
Gets the type of the data-bound control that contains this entity template.

The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl.ContainerType%2A> class provides information about the context (the control type) in which the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl> class is contained.
This type can be a list control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
It can also be a single-item control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.

You can customize the behavior of an application depending on the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl.ContainerType%2A> value, such as conditionally displaying or hiding specific UI elements.
The type that contains the template.
Gets the data-rendering mode for the entity.
The data-rendering mode for the entity.
Gets the table that the entity template applies to.
The table that the entity template applies to.
Gets the validation to apply to the entity control group.
The validation to apply to the entity control group.
